intro: Abarema abeywickramae, commonly known as the Sri Lankan evergreen tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of Sri Lanka. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understory. Its botanical features include woody stems, trifoliate leaves, and pods that contain small, rounded seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
